Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it is

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You can filter the bad ones out by nc to port 17775 as per deckers script... I made mine connect to all good ones first, but putting `addnotary` call for all nodes seemed to make it work worse, but it may have been unrelated

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there is one in SA beginning with 177 that is also an old ip

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: just a thought but maybe adding new notaries pushes old ones out

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so the highest priority goes to the most recent call

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so you would actually want to call all the good nodes last, not first

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: that's not based on anything

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: just a random idea

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: might be worth a try

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but that might explain why it made it worse

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont think it made any diffrence tbh, but after I was playing around with it my counts did go down in general.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That might have more to do with other people all using optimisations now though.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But if I force addnotary all the ones with open ports, the list had less "dead" ips in it.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: we should probably not update any coin daemons unless they are hard forking changes or include specific notary fixes

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: notary nodes are sacred

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: every time you run new software on them you put them at risk

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: the most important thing is that we run stable daemons

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: not the latest bleeding edge builds

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: totally agree

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I believe so

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: how many notary operators here actually read through every change in the entire diff before upgrading

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I would bet my money on none, if any

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We should also possibly move back to beta from dev komodo I think maybe to... as we have STAKED project to test DEV  branch now, which should find the bugs we were meant to find.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
not to mention for 3rd party daemons it would be very easy to hide
e.g some obscure file pulled down in the build script and executed

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: you could easily miss that in a diff

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: or even check the remote file and see it's good

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but then they could change it to something malicious at any point

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: easy back door

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: it's not even that uncommon for build scripts to pull in external files

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Differentiate staked and dev would make it less risky. For external daemons as long as notarize is fine yeah we should not update until requested by coin team

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: for example VRSC didn't do consensous changing update, so, we  can skip this. i didn't update mine.

Content: Check out prev commits on dev when it not compiles. It's easy. Was said that day by day debugging and testing is also job of NN ops. Not just keeping old stable beta.

Author: lukechilds#2707

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Those two things are mutually exclusive

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: you can do one or the other, not both
